messages.title: A strong, local voice for our area

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Nicola Turner and the Liberal Democrats have been fighting to save local transport links in the Colne and Holme Valleys. They have campaigned with residents to save services from Meltham to Huddersfield, via Linthwaite Heights and Minsbridge. Nicola is pressing for more decisions on the future of bus routes to be made locally, giving local people a say on their future.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Fighting to protect local NHS services
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Our area has lost out under Labour, with local maternity services cut from Huddersfield Royal Infirmary. Nicola's four children were all born at the HRI. Like many local families, they use local NHS services on a regular basis. Nationally, Conservative bosses have openly attacked the NHS as a 'sixty year mistake' They can't be trusted to save our local services. Nicola and the Lib Dems are committed to fighting to protect local NHS services.

Nicola and the Lib Dems have a strong track record of joining with local people to fight for the green belt across the Lindley Moor from development. The last green belt in Kirklees Council in the 1980s and has been threatened with development ever since. Over the years Nicola Turner the Lib Dems and local residents have fought successfully to protect it from development.

mentions.candidate: Nicola Turner has been fighting, Nicola's four children were all born
